stories.title: Show HN: We built simulator of a web developer’s job

stories.text:
I've been contemplating the idea of moving over my accounts on various services to an email on my own domain (mail@pietro72ohboy.com instead of mail@gmail.com). Since this email will serve as a gateway to accessing (and recovering access if needed) for all services, I'd want it to be reasonably secure. I've tried to stick with services that allow an extra 2FA over the traditional username/password login and I'm currently using fastmail for this.

I'd like to go back to using a service like Migadu that offer a simple, standard mail account accessible through IMAP and SMTP. Would an account secured by a sufficiently powerful password be secure enough? Or is 2FA a must for such accounts.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is email without 2FA safe?
Why Your Internal Monologue Sounds Like Your Human Voice

stories.text:
Hey HN,

Today, I'm announcing the public release of MVP of Rebudget, a personal finance app that I've been working on over the last 2 years. Rebudget helps you create a budget and track your personal finances using the zero-based budgeting or the envelope method. I originally started working on this mostly as a fun side project to experiment and see what I could do, but also as a potential Mint/YNAB replacement for myself (as well as my wife's spreadsheet!).

There is still a lot of work to be done (it may be a little rough around the edges in some places), but I'm excited about the challenges and work ahead.

I'm open to any questions or feedback that is provided. Thanks!
stories.title: Show HN: Rebudget, a personal finance app

stories.text:
Racket 8.5 is now available from https://download.racket-lang.org

See the announcement at https://blog.racket-lang.org/2022/04/racket-v8-5.html

If you are new to Racket and have questions or need a hand getting started: [Discourse](https://racket.discourse.group/) and [Discord](https://discord.gg/6Zq8sH5) are the most active places.
stories.title: Racket 8.5 Release
